image.altText: A person in a long sleeved white collared shirt and black pants walks into the Reserve Bank of Australia as its doors slide open

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank board cuts interest rates, decreasing the cash rate by 0.25 of a percentage point to 4.1 per cent.

title.children: RBA says rate cut helps borrowers but inflation 'hurts everyone'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese addresses the Labor caucus

props.synopsis: The political consequences of this historically unique moment in monetary policy will play out in coming weeks.

title.children: We may have just seen a decisive political inflection point

image.altText: Michele Bullock seated at board table

props.synopsis: Rate cuts are like cockroaches: there's rarely just one. But the RBA board has warned households and financial markets not to expect an infestation.

title.children: Traders expect four rate cuts. The RBA boss reckons they're dreaming

image.altText: Bankstown Hospital nurses Ahmad Rashad Nadir, left, and Sarah Abu Lebdeh, right, leaning in to screen

props.synopsis: A number of Muslim groups have signed an open letter condemning both the comments made by two Sydney nurses about treating Israeli patients, as well as the subsequent response.

title.children: Peak Muslim groups condemn 'selective outrage' over Sydney nurses

image.altText: A man dressed in a collared shirt holds a baby which has its face blurred.

props.synopsis: A Perth obstetrician tried to blame a rideshare driver for causing a crash that killed a 24-year-old woman, telling a court he had "only had two beers", despite recording a blood alcohol reading of 0.183 and travelling at 130kph in a 50kph zone, a court hears.

title.children: 'Why am I the bad guy?' Doctor tried to blame others for fatal crash, court told

image.altText: A plane that crashed at toronto airport lying on its back surrounded by snow and emergency personnel

props.synopsis: The plane, a CRJ-900 aircraft, was carrying 80 people when air traffic control confirmed a plane had overturned on landing in Toronto.

title.children: Seatbelts that left passengers 'hanging like bats' saved lives in Toronto crash, expert says

image.altText: A young boy, wearing a helmet stands on an e-scooter

props.synopsis: Sunshine Coast students are being told to park their transport devices off-site, and discouraged from using them at all, after an underage rider narrowly avoided a crash.

title.children: Principal bans e-scooters from school grounds after near miss with car

image.altText: Smoke rises from the bushfire threatening Windy Harbour.

props.synopsis: An emergency warning remains in place for Windy Harbour, with residents in Northcliffe also under threat.

title.children: Evacuation by boat considered as bushfire threatens WA town

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair wearing a dark jacket

props.synopsis: The 61-year-old from Lake Cathie near Port Maquarie has been charged with using a carriage service to menace, harass or offend.

title.children: Man charged over alleged harassment of journalist Antoinette Lattouf

image.altText: A selfie of a man standing on a boat on a sunny day and smiling widely.

props.synopsis: A German man and his British partner who were arrested by Australian Border Force allegedly trying to flee the nation with a fugitive have faced court in Darwin.

title.children: Sailors bailed after allegedly trying to smuggle fugitive from Australia

image.altText: A graphic showing a concerned woman looking at a phone, next to social media icons.

props.synopsis: Some parents argue it's a blatant breach of privacy. Others say it's simply a necessary precaution in the modern world. But what do the experts think?

title.children: The only reason you should snoop through your child’s phone

image.altText: A creek flows through the middle of the area where soil covers grasslands

props.synopsis: A Melbourne property developer and his business have been fined a combined $170,000 for destroying several hectares of native vegetation in Melbourne's west.

title.children: Melbourne developer, business cop $170k fine over native vegetation

image.altText: A man in a suit sits on a leather lounge, looking professional.

props.synopsis: The man appointed by the Albanese government as special envoy to combat Islamophobia has called on the prime minister to condemn the alleged attacks of two Muslim women in Melbourne.

title.children: Islamophobia envoy demands action from PM after Epping attack

image.altText: A close-up of an old man in glasses and a white hat speaks into a microphone and gestures.

props.synopsis: Officials say the 88-year-old pontiff has a "polymicrobial respiratory tract infection," but little remains known about the severity of his illness.

title.children: What we know about Pope Francis's 'complex' respiratory infection

image.altText: A screenshot of a video of a police officer tripping a man

props.synopsis: WA Police say the incident, which shows an officer knocking the man to the ground in Broome, will be investigated.

title.children: Police officer videoed throwing older man to the ground in WA's Kimberley

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: A drone image showing Macumba Beach in Rio, Brazil, full of people and umbrella shades.

props.synopsis: It is the highest temperature since the south-eastern Brazilian city started a climate alert system just over 10 years ago.

title.children: Rio's hottest day in a decade hits 44C, sending thousands to the beach

image.altText: Kyrie Irving of Team USA dribbles a basketball while pushing off Boomers' Patty Mills during an Olympic Games clash.

props.synopsis: Olympic gold medallist and NBA champion Kyrie Irving tells US media he is in the process of trying to switch allegiances to his country of birth to play for Australia's men's basketball team.

title.children: NBA All Star reportedly keen to jump ship to play for Boomers

image.altText: A cargo ship passing in the distance at Moffat Beach at Caloundra

props.synopsis: Police allege a man met a girl at a Sunshine Coast beach to supply her drugs before he sexually assaulted her.

title.children: Police say there could be more victims after man charged with rape of teen girl

image.altText: A mid-shot photo of a man wearing a white jumper

props.synopsis: A coronial inquiry hears a Melbourne teenager found dead in regional Victoria could have died from a drug overdose, hypothermia, drowning or a combination of all three.

title.children: Inquest hears mystery will remain over missing teenager's death

image.altText: Sam Wilson in a blue and red superhero outfit, squatting slightly holding a large shield with a star int he middle

props.synopsis: Rather than seizing upon a new Captain America as a fresh slate, Brave New World feels more like an MCU greatest-hits playlist to remind audiences of how much they enjoyed previous films.

title.children: Harrison Ford is a Trump-coded president in the new Captain America

image.altText: A woman leans against an older man in a hat and striped shirt and an older woman wearing glasses, all smiling.

props.synopsis: Coroners will begin assessing if a learner driver who caused the death of three people was fit to drive. The 16-year-old was found guilty of careless driving, but not guilty of the more serious crime of causing death by dangerous driving.

title.children: Inquest to see if learner driver who caused triple fatal was fit to drive

image.altText: An elderly Indigenous man wearing a suit looks at the camera

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal Northern Territory politician says he believes racism is worsening in Darwin after he was asked to show identification before refuelling a rental car at a service station.

title.children: Aboriginal politician calls out racism after he had to show ID at service station

image.altText: A wide shot of iron ore being loaded onto a ship in Port Hedland.

props.synopsis: BHP has reported a 23 per cent fall in first-half profit, but the miner says demand for key commodities should improve.

title.children: BHP records 23pc fall in first-half profit

image.altText: french president macron stands in paris next to a french guard who is saluting

props.synopsis: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said "a US security guarantee is the only way to effectively deter Russia from attacking Ukraine again".

title.children: 'US backstop' Ukraine's only defence against Russia says EU leaders

image.altText: A young woman wearing a black dress with tubes attached to an IV drip gives the peace sign

props.synopsis: Young people are more than twice as likely to get forms of bowel cancer than older Australians were at the same age, and researchers have a few clues as to why.

title.children: Massive spike in number of young people getting bowel cancer

image.altText: The back of the head of a man wearing a cap and glasses, sitting outside. His face cannot be seen.

props.synopsis: Experts and families are warning that the current system to intervene and rehabilitate people who have joined extremist groups is flawed.

title.children: Chris fears his brother may carry out a 'lone wolf attack'. He's pleading for help

image.altText: A man holds a woman's head and kisses her.

props.synopsis: A Foreign Correspondent investigation has detailed the decades of sexism and misogyny leading up to the infamous World Cup kiss.

title.children: Infamous World Cup kiss blew lid on open secret in women's football

image.altText: A man with a white cap and black sunglasses walks between a TV cameraman and another man dressed in black.

props.synopsis: From 1961 to 1990, the Catholic Church shunted priest Gerald Ridsdale to 16 different parishes across Australia, enabling him to sexually abuse at least 72 children.

title.children: Notorious Ridsdale's death at 90 leaves scores of shattered victims

image.altText: Birdseye view of a young girl drawing at a table.

props.synopsis: National test results show just 28 per cent of Year 10 students are proficient in civics.

title.children: Call for 'immediate' curriculum overhaul after 'shocking' civics results

image.altText: duncan campbell with sunny holiday background facing camera

props.synopsis: Detectives are determined to find the killer of a Coffs Harbour grandfather who had fallen on hard times.

title.children: Police offer $500k reward in beloved grandfather murder investigation

image.altText: Bouquets of flowers pinned to a tree covered in vines, off a country bitumen road.

props.synopsis: Police allege a New South Wales man breached an apprehended domestic violence order and drove negligently when he went over an embankment and smashed into a tree, killing his female passenger.

title.children: Man charged with negligent driving after fatal crash near Orange

image.altText: A blackened window with insulation exposed.

props.synopsis: Detectives investigating a fire that killed a 27-year-old woman at Truganina in January believe the arson attack is linked to Victoria's tobacco wars. The woman is not believed to be involved in the dispute.

title.children: 'Faceless and gutless' arson attackers got wrong address in fatal blaze
